text.p: France has flown home 22 Moroccan and 16 Zairean immigrants in the 29th such expulsion since the conservative government took office 17 months ago, the interior ministry said on Thursday.
It said the immigrants, either illegal immigrants or convicts expelled after serving prison sentences, were flown home on Wednesday aboard a government-chartered airliner.
The government, which has pledged a crackdown on clandestine immigration, has expelled more than 18,000 illegal residents since it took office, including more than 10,500 this year.
In a crackdown on illegal labour, the authorities have closed down 34 sweatshops and ordered legal proceedings against 949 employers over the past few months, the ministry said.
